nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Info
widgets_values:
Bypassing SageAttention/Triton improves quality but increases generation time.

SageAttention and Trition speed up generation, but are not installed in the standard ComfyUI. If you don't know how to install them, it's best to ask an AI. I asked [perplexity.ai](https://perplexity.ai) and was successfully guided through the installation step by step. Since the installation varies depending on the system, universal instructions cannot be provided here. Be sure to create a backup of ComfyUI beforehand, as problems during installation can also cause ComfyUI to stop working.

âš ï¸â€¼ï¸If the output image is completely black, this indicates an error with the `sage_attention` model. You should then select the model variant that matches your system configuration. Bypass the group if SageAttention and Triton are not installedâ€¼ï¸âš ï¸

nodes.title: ðŸª„Refiner Seed (change value until you are happy with the image)
ðŸ’¡Installation Instruction
widgets_values: This workflow uses RES4LYF nodes, which can be installed via the ComfyUI Manager.

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Image Quality and Detail Levels
widgets_values:
Schedulers listed from the clearest image with the fewest details to the noisiest with the most details: **simple**, **normal**, **beta**, **beta57**.

- **simple** requires the highest number of steps to achieve the same level of detail as **beta57**.  
- **beta57** is the most aggressive scheduler, it needs fewer steps but introduces more visible noise.  
- For the best balance of clarity and texture, **simple** with a higher step count is recommended.

**ddim_uniform** can produce unique and visually striking results, especially at low step counts. At these lower values, shadows are often reduced or missing, giving the image a high dynamic range (HDR) appearance.

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Defaults (CFG: 1.0)
widgets_values:
|               | official | good   | great  | great | excellent |
|---------------|----------|--------|--------|-------|-----------|
| **Steps**     | 9        | 5      | 9      | 18    | 30        |
| **Scheduler** | euler    | res_2s | res_2s | deis  | sa_solver |
| **Sampler**   | simple   | beta57 | beta   | beta  | simple    |

**normal** can be a good alternative as scheduler.

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Refiner Guide
widgets_values:
If you like the first image, you can skip the **ðŸ’ŽRefiner** step by using the **ðŸ’¤Fast Group Bypasser** at the top. If there are details in the image that bother you, you can enable the **ðŸ’ŽRefiner** to generate alternative versions of the image.

â€‹Make sure that in the first group's **ðŸ–¼ï¸KSampler**, the **control after generate** option is set to **fixed**. Don't forget to reduce the initial seed value by one if **increase** was the last setting to match the value of the current image. This lets you change the **ðŸª„Refiner Seed** value of this group if you are not satisfied with the alternative yet. The exact seed value does not matter, it just needs to be different from the one used in the **ðŸ–¼ï¸KSampler**.

â€‹While the ðŸ‘€âœ¨ðŸŽžï¸ and **ðŸ“‚Save Final Image** groups are bypassed, you can repeatedly start the image generation with a new seed value and compare the new result with the first image in the preview at the bottom. Once you are happy with the result, you can optionally run the **ðŸ‘€Face Refiner** for fixing ugly faces and **âœ¨SeedVR2 Upscale** afterward, which is especially useful if you need a very sharp image. 

â€‹However, this additional sharpness can sometimes make the image look worse, depending on the subject, especially when the original softness is what makes the image feel vivid and natural.

If you like the analog look of image noise, activate the **ðŸŽžï¸Film Grain** group.

By the way: It is also possible to generate a slightly different alternative of the first image with the same seed in the **ðŸ–¼ï¸KSampler**. Just add a character without special meaning like a dot for every alternative at the end of your prompt. Maybe the third one is the best...

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Image Generation Tips
widgets_values: You can bypass groups to skip them. Use the ðŸ’¤Fast Groups Bypasser node, to control this easily.

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡Face Refinement Tips
widgets_values: Z-Image-Turbo often generates faces that donâ€™t require additional optimization, so bypassing the group is an option. If the effect is too subtle, increase the **denoise** value; if it's too strong, lower it. For systems with limited GPU power, you can safely reduce the step count to 6. Change the seed for alternative faces.

nodes.title: ðŸ’¡SeedVR2 Upscaling Guide
widgets_values:
SeedVR2 is a powerful upscaling tool optimized for workflows with very low source image sizes and very high output resolutions. It excels when adding significant detail to smaller images.  

### Source Image Size and Quality
- Optimal source size: Between approximately 0.1 and 1 megapixels.
- A common sweet spot is 0.27 MP (512 Ã— 512 pixels), which balances detail enhancement and texture preservation.
- Increasing the source image size preserves more original texture, but fewer new details will be added.  

### Output Image Resolution and VRAM

- The higher the output resolution, the better the final quality. 6 megapixels seem to be the sweat spot.
- This workflow was developed and tested with 32 GB of VRAM and 96 GB of RAM, allowing output images up to approximately 8.85 megapixels without tiling. Without tiling the best results are often achieved at around 6 megapixels.
- For systems with less VRAM:
  - Enable the encode_tiled and decode_tiled options.
  - Start with a tile size of 1024 pixels. The higher, the better. The size should be divisible by 64.
  - If you encounter out-of-memory errors, reduce the tile size (e.g., to 768).
  - If memory issues persist, reduce the target output megapixel size accordingly.
- Check the console log for detailed memory usage; it provides clues on which parameters to adjust.

### Memory Management for Lower VRAM GPUs
- If your GPU has less than 24 GB of VRAM, use block swapping and activate swapping of IO components.
- Block swapping dynamically moves transformer blocks between GPU and CPU memory, allowing large models to run on limited VRAM.
- Adjust the blocks_to_swap parameter (3B: 0-32, 7B: 0-36) to balance VRAM savings and processing speed:
  - Lower values speed up processing but use more VRAM.
  - Higher values save VRAM but slow down performance.
- For an in-depth tutorial on block swapping and optimal settings, watch [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MBtWYXq_r60).

### Automatic Downloads

- The selected model and VAE files will be downloaded automatically on first use.
- âš ï¸ Because these models are large, the download may take several minutes.
- Monitor the console log for download progress.
- Manual download into the ðŸ“‚`ComfyUI\models\SEEDVR2` directory is possible. Models can be found [here](https://huggingface.co/numz/SeedVR2_comfyUI/tree/main) and [here](https://huggingface.co/AInVFX/SeedVR2_comfyUI/tree/main).

In most cases, the 7B model delivers better overall results than the 7B_sharp variant. Which one performs best depends on the specific image. Contrary to its name, 7B_sharp is not necessarily sharper; instead, it can produce finer details and better lighting but comes with a higher risk of artifacts, especially in smooth or plain areas.

The 3B model tends to perform better than the 7B model when the input image is blurry, as it handles such cases more effectively.

For the best image quality, choose the fp16 precision setting. If you want to reduce VRAM usage, opt for fp8, or even more compact formats like Q8 or Q4, keeping in mind that lower precision may slightly reduce output fidelity.

nodes.title: â„¹ï¸Workflow INFO
widgets_values:
# PhotoFlow Z-Image-Turbo v2.0

This text-to-image workflow is specifically designed to generate images with a strong emphasis on realism. To further enhance the resolution and quality significantly, the SeedVR2 video upscaler is ideal, as it refines finer details without compromising the original texture integrity.

## Recommended Model Downloads

### Z-Image-Turbo
Save path ðŸ“‚`ComfyUI/models/diffusion_models`:  

If you have 16GB or more of VRAM the bf16 safetenors model is recommended.  
[Download](https://civitai.com/models/2168935?modelVersionId=2442439) `zImage_turbo.safetensors`  

If you want to speed up the generation or have less VRAM the fp8 model is recommended.  
[Download](https://civitai.com/models/2169712?modelVersionId=2445746) `zImageTurboQuantized_fp8ScaledE4m3fnKJ.safetensors`

### Text Encoder
Save path ðŸ“‚`ComfyUI/models/text_encoders`:  

[Download](https://civitai.com/models/2168935?modelVersionId=2442540) `zImage_textEncoder.safetensors`  

### VAE
Save path ðŸ“‚`ComfyUI\models\vae`:  
[Download](https://civitai.com/models/2168935?modelVersionId=2442479) `zImage_vae.safetensors`  
It's the same as the Flux VAE.

### LoRAs (optional, highly recommended)

This workflow was developed to generate photorealistic images with a neutral appearance by default, capturing a moment as if it were a real, unaltered scene. The goal is to achieve this realism without having to apply specific artistic styles unless desired. However, users should still be able to create different styles purely through prompt instructions, without changing LoRAs or their strength settings. The neutral look should not be artificially forced.  

Since no single LoRA can achieve this flexibility, as each is optimized for a particular style, the workflow combines several LoRAs at different strengths. After hundreds of tests, this combination has proven to meet the intended balance between realism and adaptability.  
Be cautious when adjusting LoRA strengths! Z-Image-Turbo is highly sensitive to even minor changes when multiple LoRAs are active. A tweak that improves one image may negatively affect others.  

This setup also includes a LoRA designed to create more realistic soft NSFW imagery.

#### Version Requirements

âš ï¸ **Use the exact versions listed in this guide, even if newer ones are available.**  These specific versions were found to work best in combination when the workflow was created. Updating to newer releases will not improve results unless you also readjust all LoRA weights.

âš ï¸ **Ensure that ComfyUI version 0.3.76 or newer is installed.** Earlier versions (up to 0.3.75) process LoRAs incorrectly when multiple are combined, resulting in significantly different output compared to the intended results.

Save path ðŸ“‚`ComfyUI\models\loras`:  

[Download NiceGirls UltraReal](https://civitai.com/models/1862761?modelVersionId=2465980) (v1.0 Z-Image Turbo) `nicegirls_Zimage.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.45**

[Download PhotoReal BetterNudes](https://civitai.com/models/2174081?modelVersionId=2455720) (v2.0) `b3tternud3s_v2.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.20**

[Download AfterDark](https://civitai.com/models/2176378?modelVersionId=2450841) (v1.0) `afterdark_z_image_turbo.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.10**

[Download Lenovo UltraReal](https://civitai.com/models/1662740?modelVersionId=2452071) (v1.0 Z-Image Turbo) `lenovo_z.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.08**

[Download psxZStyle - Photography Style Lora](https://civitai.com/models/2076522?modelVersionId=2456035) (v1.0 - ZIT) `psxZStyle_v1_ZIT.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.10**

[Download 35mm Photo](https://civitai.com/models/660731?modelVersionId=2462523) (v0.1) `Z-TURBO_Photography_35mmPhoto_896.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.10**

[Download Movie Wide Angle](https://civitai.com/models/2186574/movie-wide-angle-z-image-lora?modelVersionId=2462010) (v1.0) `movie_zimage_lora.safetensors`  
LoRA strength: **0.08**

The order in which the LoRAs are loaded is also relevant. Different orders lead to different weighting calculations. 

## Installation

### ComfyUI Manager Installation
[https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager?tab=readme-ov-file#comfyui-manager](https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager?tab=readme-ov-file#comfyui-manager)

### Installation of Missing Nodes

Missing nodes in this workflow are highlighted in red. To install them, open the ComfyUI Manager and click the 'Install Missing Custom Nodes' button. 

After the installation, restart ComfyUI and refresh the browser page.

 
## TL;DR
Check my Civitai profile for updates and other workflows: [https://civitai.com/user/ai839](https://civitai.com/user/ai839)
